content: rest of the round with *k3 p1 * every third round make increases for the thumb gusset for example the second set of increases will look like this needle one k3 p1 k1 m1l k3 m1r k1 p1 *k3 p1* for the remainder of the round the next two rounds will be k3 p1 k7 p1 k3 p1 every third round make increases for the thumb gusset by m1l and m1r after the first stitch and before the last one as has been established in previous increases the number of stitches between the increases will grow keep making increases every third round until there are 13 stitches in your thumb gusset continue to knit in pattern until the thumb gusset reaches the base of your thumb for me that was another 6 rounds when it reaches the desired length do the following on needle one k3 p1 cast three stitches onto the right needle using the backwards loop technique place the 13 thumb gusset stitches onto a length of waste yarn p1 *k3 p1* for the remainder of the round continue 3 x 1 rib stitch pattern for another 2 inches or until you reach the desired length for 1/2 mitts on the next round decrease 4 sts equally 40 sts will look like this *k8 k2tog* total 36 sts 44 sts will look like this *k9 k2tog* total 40 sts 48 sts will look like this *k10 k2tog* total 44 sts purl the entire next round 2 | ©d iana t w iss 2 01 4 100 m ile w ear c om next and final round bind off in purl stitch making the thumb knit 6 of the thumb gusset stitches onto needle one knit another 6 onto needle two using needle three knit the last stitch from the thumb gusset and then pick up one stitch on the side making sure to twist the stitch so as to close the loop pick up 3 stitches from the backwards loop cast on stitches again twisting by knitting into the back of the stitch to close the loop pick up another stitch on the other side of the thumb 6 sts knit these 18 sts in the round until the thumb reaches the desired length approximately one inch bind of in purl stitch weave in loose ends hand wash mitts in warm soapy water roughing them up a bit will make the yarn bloom towel dry and block definitions dpn double pointed needles m1l make 1 left insert left needle from front to back under strand of yarn which runs between last stitch on left needle and first stitch on right needle knit this stitch through back loop 1 stitch increased left leaning increase m1r make 1 right insert left needle from back to front under strand of yarn which runs between last stitch on left needle and first stitch on right needle knit this stitch through the front loop 1 stitch increased right leaning increase 3 | ©d
